channel.description: Advanced Text File I/O Though the File.ReadAllText and File.WriteAllText methods provide simple mechanisms for reading and writing text files, they are not always the best choices. For one reason, files can be very large â€” too large to fit into memory, or possibly even larger than the maximum length of a string in C# (2,147,483,647 characters). Even when it is possible to store the entire contents of a file as a string, it may not be desirable, as the high memory usage may degrade the overall performance of the system.
